title: Angular momentum - change due to tangential force

content.question: A force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted tangentially to the edge of a horizontal disk of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The force is exerted over a time interval <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>, during which time the disk rotates through an angle of <math alttext="the fraction pi over 2, end fraction, radians" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>rad</mi></math>. What is the change in the angular momentum of the disk during the time interval <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction pi F R over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction with numerator F delta t, and denominator R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>F</mi><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi F R, and denominator 2 delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
